oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Daniel Morgan
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Daniel Morgan, wearing frontier garb in buckskin clothing, holding a rifle. A powder horn is slung across his shoulder, and a hat is at his feet.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Generals; Military officers
Morgan, Daniel, 1736-1802; Armed Forces -- Officers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Morgan rose to the rank of brigadier general during the Revolutionary War and served with distinction at the Battles of Saratoga, New York, and the Battle of Cowpens, South Carolina. After the war he helped put down the Whiskey Rebellion (1794).
